messages.message:
When our docs talk about golden tests, what specifically are we referring to? Where can I learn more about golden tests? Or are golden tests unique to our Instabase lingo?  @Aaron Vontell can you help?
For example, @laura and I are working to improve the Test Runner app (https://dogfood.instabase.com/docs/reference/apps/test-runner/) doc:
> If you choose one of the validation types that require a “golden” (aka reference) comparison file, you will need to create this reference file. See the _Reference_ section for more details.
> One suggestion for creating “golden” .ibocr files for V1 Test Runner: Run an existing Flow, and use that as a template that you can then manually inspect and modify to what you expect to get.
I think in this case it’s talking about the expected output of a Flow. Expected (human curated) output is normally called a golden set even outside of instabase.
I’m pretty sure the quotes aren’t necessary, but wondering if that’s just my bias
Yes, @laura you're correct, with your description, I was able to find https://softwareengineering.stackexchange.com/questions/358786/what-is-golden-files#
